intro: Hyalolaena turcomanica, commonly known as the Turkmenian hyalolaena, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Hyalolaena turcomanica thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
